prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Sloped Side Step 1: Create the Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: (-90.0, 0.0, -90.0) * Translation Vector: (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) Step 2: Draw the 2D Sketch In the XY plane, draw a sketch with the following components: * Face 1 + Loop 1 - Line 1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0), End Point (0.75, 0.0) - Line 2: Start Point (0.75, 0.0), End Point (0.75, 0.125) - Line 3: Start Point (0.75, 0.125), End Point (0.5, 0.125) - Line 4: Start Point (0.5, 0.125), End Point (0.25, 0.125) - Line 5: Start Point (0.25, 0.125), End Point (0.0, 0.125) - Line 6: Start Point (0.0, 0.125), End Point (0.0, 0.0) Step 3: Transform the Sketch into 3D Transform the 2D sketch using the coordinate system parameters and a scaling factor of 0.75. Step 4: Extrude the Sketch to Create the 3D Model Extrude the 2D sketch along its normal direction by 0.5 units and set the opposing direction extrusion depth as 0.0 units. This creates a rectangular prism with a sloped side, and completes the first part of the CAD assembly. Part 2: Rectangular Prism with a Slightly Tapered Top and Bottom Step 1: Create the Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: (-90.0, 0.0, -90.0) * Translation Vector: (0.0, 0.25, 0.125) Step 2: Draw the 2D Sketch In the XY plane, draw a sketch with the following components: * Face 1 + Loop 1 - Line 1: Start Point (0.0, 0.125), End Point (0.25, 0.125) - Line 2: Start Point (0.25, 0.125), End Point (0.25, 0.0) - Line 3: Start Point (0.25, 0.0), End Point (0.5, 0.0) - Line 4: Start Point (0.5, 0.0), End Point (0.5, 0.375) - Line 5: Start Point (0.5, 0.375), End Point (0.25, 0.375) - Line 6: Start Point (0.25, 0.375), End Point (0.25, 0.25) - Line 7: Start Point (0.25, 0.25), End Point (0.0, 0.25) - Line 8: Start Point (0.0, 0.25), End Point (0.0, 0.125) Step 3: Transform the Sketch into 3D Transform the 2D sketch using the coordinate system parameters and a scaling factor of 0.5. Step 4: Extrude the Sketch to Create the 3D Model Extrude the 2D sketch along its normal direction by 0.5 units and set the opposing direction extrusion depth as 0.0 units. This creates a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom, and completes the second part of the CAD assembly.</description>
